results.title: The Joke = Zert [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jaromil Jires, Milos Stejskal, Filmove Studio Barrandov and Smida-Fikar Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Milan Kundera’s novel “The Unbearable Lightness of Being”, “The Joke” is a blunt parable about the Stalinist era’s absurd insistence that every individual must, at every moment, act with the political party in mind. In the early 1950s, Louis Jahn’s studies, career and life have been disrupted beyond repair as a result of a “politically incorrect” joke he played. Fifteen years later, Louis sees a unique chance to revenge himself upon the Communist party official that bought him down. But the times have changed and life proves to be more complicated than he had expected. Jaromil Jires was one of the preeminent Czech directors of the period, and “The Joke” was one of the key works of the Czech New Wave, a highly politicised film movement that emerged in the 1960s only to be savagely repressed by the Soviet invasion of Czechoslavakia in 1968. “The Joke” was finished just before the Soviet tanks moved in to Prague and was condemned by the new government. As a result the film went largely unseen, even in its own country, for nearly two decades.

results.title: The Jogger
results.creator_credit: Steve Karp, Atlantis Films and Perk Productions
results.brief_description: A middle-aged male jogger runs alone thorugh snow-covered Central Park as “the metaphor” for the break-up of a marriage. A dialogue beginning before the marriage and tracing its dissolution, is heard throughout the run. The man’s adult life is traced by the dialogue and raises many questions for the viewer about life and human relations.

results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Jigsaw Man
results.creator_credit: Terence Young, Benjamin Fisz and J&M Entertainment
results.brief_description: Spy thriller inspired by the true story of British intelligence officer and Soviet spy Kim Philby (1912-1988). Having defected to Russia in 1979, Sir Philip Kimberly (Michael Caine), Cambridge graduate and former Director-General of M.I.6 is called upon by the Russians to carry out one last mission. With a different identity and a face altered beyond recognition by plastic surgery, he is sent back to England in the guise of a Soviet citizen to retrieve a secret dossier of names he supposedly hid there several years ago. When he decides to defect a second time the viewer is drawn into a complex web of espionage, counter-espionage and counter-counter-espionage where nothing is as it at first appears. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Susan George and Robert Powell.

results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.4. an Uneasy Peace
results.brief_description: As the war comes to a close, the British attempt to bring order to an India in transition. But hopes of a peaceful solution are crushed by forces of anger, frustration and violence. India’s conflicts, buried and ignored during the war with Japan, now burst forth with renewed and unexpected brutality. Death, despair and suicide soon become part of the daily life of all those who remain in the turbulent nation. Rated: M

results.title: The Jerusalem passion
results.brief_description: Recorded live in the Concert Hall of the Queensland Performing Arts Complex on 9th April 1988. “The Jerusalem passion” was composed and conducted by Christian music director, Murray Wylie and features the Vision One Choir and Orchestra, supported by vocalists Sue Elliott, Jeff Baldock, David Hall, Helen Maguire, Jim McCrystal, Damien Roche, Julie Vidler and Kate Wylie. Playing the pipe organ is Eduarda Van Klinken and the oratorio is narrated by Helen Foster. Vision One is an Australia-wide Christian music initiative.
